turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about M35 series 2½-ton 6x6 cargo truck.
turn.1: What was the primary use of the M35 series trucks?
turn.2: The M756 was a specialized pipeline repair vehicle, the M763 was designed for telephone line repair, and the M764 was a specialized earth-boring and pole-setting variant.
turn.3: What is an example of a secondary use of the truck?
turn.4: The versatility of the pattern was perhaps shown best in its usage as an armored "gun truck" for patrol duties and convoy escort.
turn.5: How was the truck modified for secondary use?
turn.6: The simplest examples were produced by simply placing an existing light gun mount directly onto the cargo bed of the truck, and securing it in place.
turn.7: What other secondary uses were made of the truck?
turn.8: No armouring or special support equipment was installed.
turn.9: Was the truck used for a military purpose?
turn.10: One such conversion was performed in Congo-Leopoldville in 1965, using an Oerlikon GAI 20 mm anti-aircraft gun.
turn.11: Did the truck have other military applications?
turn.12: Another conversion in the Congo entailed mounting pods with 2.75" aircraft rockets on a pedestal on the cargo bed, but this proved unsuccessful.
